common.tagline: Zero CAPEX Shore Power Solutions for Cruise Terminals

hero.title: Zero CAPEX Shore Power Solutions
hero.subtitle: by CleanDock?
hero.description: We mitigate financial and operational burdens for harbours through our flexible Build, Own, Operate (BOO) model.

valueProposition.title: Build, Own, Operate (BOO) Model
valueProposition.description: Our flexible BOO model mitigates financial barriers while delivering comprehensive shore power solutions
valueProposition.zeroCapexDesc: If chosen, no upfront investment is required for the harbour. However, you may want to co-invest and share profits. We finance, build, own, and operate the infrastructure.
valueProposition.operationalSupportDesc: Complete management of shore power systems including maintenance, monitoring, and 24/7 support.
valueProposition.revenueSharingDesc: Harbours can benefit from profit sharing with limited financial risks associated with infrastructure ownership.
valueProposition.riskMitigationDesc: We take on technical, financial, and operational risks associated with shore power implementation.
valueProposition.environmentalComplianceDesc: Meet and exceed environmental regulations with our sustainable shore power solutions.
valueProposition.rapidDeploymentDesc: Fast-track implementation with our experienced team and proven methodologies.
valueProposition.whyChooseDesc: Traditional shore power projects require significant capital investment and technical expertise. Our flexible BOO model mitigates or removes these barriers, allowing harbours to focus on their core operations while we handle the complexities of shore power infrastructure.
valueProposition.noFinancialRisk: Minimal to no financial risk for harbour authorities
valueProposition.coInvestmentDesc: If a harbour opts for part-ownership (any value over 0%), profit sharing typically scales with the ownership percentage.
valueProposition.illustrativeNote: Illustrative correlation only. Final terms depend on utilisation, tariff structure, and contract.
valueProposition.correlationInfo100: Illustrative: if Co-investment is 0% → Profit sharing is 0%. Otherwise Profit sharing ≈ 10% + 0.7 × Co-investment (capped at 100%).
valueProposition.capexInfo: Illustrative: CAPEX reduction = 100% − Co-investment (relative to fully self-funded).
valueProposition.correlationInfo: Model: if co-investment = 0% → profit sharing = 0%. Otherwise, profit sharing ≈ 15% + 0.75 × ownership, capped at 60%. This is illustrative; actual terms depend on utilisation, tariff structure, and contract.

solution.title: Complete Shore Power Infrastructure
solution.description: End-to-end shore power solutions designed specifically for cruise terminals, from initial assessment to ongoing operations
solution.assessmentDesc: Comprehensive site evaluation and customised solution design for your specific harbour requirements.
solution.infrastructureDesc: Full-scale deployment of shore power equipment including transformers, switchgear, and connection systems.
solution.gridIntegrationDesc: Seamless connection to local power grids with advanced load management and safety systems.
solution.operationsDesc: 24/7 monitoring, preventive maintenance, and technical support for optimal performance.
solution.highVoltageDesc: 6.6kV-11kV systems compatible with major cruise lines
solution.vesselCompatibilityDesc: Supports all major cruise ship power requirements
solution.smartMonitoringDesc: Real-time power management and usage analytics
solution.energyStorageDesc: Optional battery systems for peak load management

stakeholders.title: Tailored Solutions for Every Partner
stakeholders.description: Our flexible BOO model creates value for all stakeholders in the shore power ecosystem

harbourAuthorities.title: Harbour Authorities
harbourAuthorities.description: Transform your harbour into a sustainable cruise destination with flexible financial risk models

localAuthorities.title: Local Authorities
localAuthorities.description: Drive sustainable port development while supporting local economic growth.

terminalOperators.title: Terminal Operators
terminalOperators.description: Enhance terminal operations with reliable shore power infrastructure.

technologyProviders.title: Technology Providers
technologyProviders.description: Partner with us to deploy cutting-edge shore power technology at scale.

investors.title: Investors
investors.description: Stable returns from essential maritime infrastructure with long-term contracts.

benefits.title: Environmental & Economic Advantages
benefits.description: Our shore power solutions deliver measurable benefits for both the environment and your bottom line
benefits.emissionReductionDesc: Significant reduction in CO2, NOx, SOx, and particulate matter emissions
benefits.airQualityDesc: Elimination of auxiliary engine emissions during port stays
benefits.regulatoryComplianceDesc: Exceed current and upcoming environmental regulations
benefits.capexEliminationDesc: No upfront investment as option for harbour authorities
benefits.operationalEfficiencyDesc: Continuous monitoring and maintenance by our expert team
benefits.revenueGenerationDesc: Harbours can benefit from profit sharing from co-investment
benefits.noDebt: No debt or equity requirements from harbour
benefits.fixedCosts: Fixed operational costs with predictable budgeting
benefits.revenueSharing: Profit sharing from shore power services
benefits.increasedPreference: Increased cruise line preference and traffic
benefits.businessCase: The Business Case for Shore Power
benefits.businessCaseDesc: Shore power is no longer just an environmental initiative—it's a strategic business decision that delivers both ecological and financial returns
benefits.euMandateInfo: Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR): From 2030, major EU ports must offer shore power to passenger and container ships at berth
benefits.cruisePreferenceInfo: CLIA: 80% of cruise fleet expected to be OPS-equipped by 2028. Source: https://cruising.org/onshore-power-supply-ops
benefits.roiInfo: Indicative; depends on utilisation, tariff structure, and the BOO funding model
benefits.globalAvailabilityInfo: Today, ~3% of global cruise terminals provide shore power; availability is growing as regulations expand
benefits.outlook2035Info: By 2035, most major cruise terminals are expected to offer shore power due to regulatory and industry commitments

partnership.title: Building Long-Term Partnerships
partnership.description: Our collaborative approach ensures successful shore power implementation through strong public-private partnerships
partnership.initialConsultationDesc: Comprehensive assessment of harbour requirements and feasibility study
partnership.stakeholderAlignmentDesc: Engagement with all relevant parties including energy providers and authorities
partnership.agreementFinalizationDesc: BOO contract negotiation and long-term partnership establishment
partnership.implementationTimelineDesc: Coordinated deployment with minimal disruption to harbour operations
partnership.commissioningDesc: Rigorous testing and certification with all stakeholders
partnership.ongoingPartnershipDesc: Continuous optimisation and long-term collaborative success
partnership.sharedSuccessDesc: Our success is directly tied to your success through profit sharing and performance metrics
partnership.publicPrivateDesc: Expertise in navigating complex public-private collaboration structures
partnership.technologyNeutralityDesc: Flexible approach to technology selection based on specific harbour needs
partnership.localDevelopmentDesc: Job creation and local supplier engagement in project implementation
partnership.successFactorsDesc: Key elements that ensure successful shore power partnerships
partnership.stakeholderAlignmentSuccessDesc: Early engagement with all stakeholders ensures smooth implementation and long-term success
partnership.clearFrameworkDesc: Well-defined agreements that protect all parties and ensure mutual benefit
partnership.sharedVisionDesc: Common goals for sustainability and economic growth drive partnership success

contact.title: Start Your Shore Power Journey
contact.description: Ready to co-invest or eliminate CAPEX and operational burdens? Contact our team to explore how our flexible BOO model can work for your harbour.
contact.subject: Subject
contact.thankYou: Thank you for your inquiry! Our partnership team will contact you within 2 business days.
contact.foundersIntro: CleanDock’s founders have held senior executive roles across telecom, energy, maritime, and infrastructure. One founder has also served as a commercial diplomat. They bring many years of Asia experience to strengthen market access, partnerships, and execution.
contact.executiveLeadershipCaption: Founders with extensive executive management experience
contact.partnershipNetworkCaption: Strong public and private sector relationships

footer.description: Leading provider of flexible Build, Own, Operate (BOO) shore power solutions for cruise terminals. CleanDock eliminates CAPEX and operational burdens for sustainable port development.
footer.euComplianceDesc: Supporting Alternative Fuels Infrastructure Regulation (AFIR) and Fit for 55 initiatives
